TITLES??: The Yakima Valley is known for growing hops.
75% of the United States' hops are grown here.
This is Perrault Farms, where fourth-generation hops farmer Jason Perrault is leading the way on new hops varieties and boosting the trend of fresh hop beers.
It's the first day of harvest and that means brewers are starting to makebeers with FRESH HOPS.
Fresh hop beers use hops harvested from the field that morning to create aromatic hop-forward beers you can only get during the harvest season.
As the top cutters move through the fields early in the morning in Toppenish, Steve Luke of Cloudburst Brewing is starting his two-hour drive from Seattle to Perrault Farms to get fresh hops.
Hop vines are cut from their trellises and hauled to the harvester by trucks.

But for brewers to pick up fresh, or "wet," hops, they are diverted here where they can fill up bags or boxes to transport back to their brewery immediately.
